definition: to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
retirement pension

sentences.english: So I will, when I retire from this position, have much more time.
sentences.chinese: 当我从这份工作退下来后，我会有更多的时间。

sentences.english: The operating team was very good, so I had to step down .
sentences.chinese: 这个团队运营得非常好，所以我就退下来了。

sentences.english: And that too, after a little while, is gone.
sentences.chinese: 而那，没过一会儿，也就全退下去了。

sentences.english: She issued a statement to the effect that she would resign from the post.
sentences.chinese: 她发表了一个声明说她不会从那个位置上退下去。

sentences.english: After my retirement I shall continue to be devoted to their cause.
sentences.chinese: 退下来之后，我将继续忠于党和国家的事业。

sentences.english: Jinchang feel should be retired, he has to arrange promotion took charge.
sentences.chinese: 金昌觉得自己应退下来，他已安排晋升接任当家之位。

sentences.english: Cecil cool, so charming the sweet-scented osmanthus in autumn withdrew earlier stage.
sentences.chinese: 丝丝凉凉，让娇美的桂花早些退下了秋的舞台。

sentences.english: The ebb was to fall early in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 根据推算，潮水将在清晨退下去。

sentences.english: We'll have to back down carefully.
But when the tempers start to flare, step back and take a breather.
sentences.chinese: 但当火气开始冒头时，退下来歇口气。

sentences.english: From then on, back to the old, new.
sentences.chinese: 从此，退下旧的，换上新的。

sentences.english: I want to return this radio.
Mr. Warren will retire from the directorship of the Microsoft soon.
sentences.chinese: 沃伦先生很快就要从微软公司主管职位上退下来。

definition: to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
to accept an order
to wave (one's hand)
to send away/to dismiss (servants etc)/to retire from public life
to tell/to instruct/to command
to bow
to shout an order or command
to salute/to make one's salutations
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
to follow your orders/to do as you bid
to promise/to agree to do sth
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to reply
to act tactfully/tactful/discreet
to salute/to greet
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
